name: places/ChIJxxGOLbBYwokRZYYqGVVcbjQ
formattedAddress: 1737 York Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1737 York Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text:
I signed up for scuba class in July however, due to some health issues I had to push back when I was going to take it. The shop was understanding and gave me no issues about changing my scuba class date.

In October I went to class. I only had a few other people in my class who were awesome classmates by the way. My instructor was Eliza. There was a few different skills that I did, these particular  skills made me very nervous. Eliza was able to sense this and did not push but waited till I was comfortable to have me try again. I left class feeling accomplished, and satisfied about what I had done.

I feel extra obligated to write this five star review as left my dive sheet at home before my scuba trip to the Caribbean. I emailed the dive shop and almost immediately he emailed me back my dive sheet, so I was able to dive on my trip.

Please don’t be afraid and give Scuba a try at Scuba Adventures.

originalText.text: Went to this shop years ago to get initial certification. They offered pool verification along with a package that included a mask and fins. Did the certification and took home the gear that we were fitted with, then got a call saying we had “taken” premium gear and our credit cards would be charged or we would need to return it immediately. Even though we brought back the gear, the shop owner treated us as if we had done something wrong by somehow selecting premium gear (as scuba newbies) outside of what was offered (when the worker in the shop had helped us find the gear we wound up taking home). No thank yous for returning the gear, no apologies for the inconvenience. When somebody is unkind and treats you poorly, you never forget it.

originalText.text: I had great experiences with Adventure Scuba - I got my open water certification (classroom and contained dives) thru the team there. Super nice and knowledgeable. Made the experience great. I also bought my initial gear on-site which I took to the BVI for some amazing diving and got an amazing conch shell from the bottom (see my pictures below).

text.text: I had great experiences with Adventure Scuba - I got my open water certification (classroom and contained dives) thru the team there. Super nice and knowledgeable. Made the experience great. I also bought my initial gear on-site which I took to the BVI for some amazing diving and got an amazing conch shell from the bottom (see my pictures below).

originalText.text: Fantastic dive shop to get any scuba gear you may need and to get your initial PADI scuba certification with the 2-day indoor pool training they do across the street at Asphalt Green. Tom was our scuba instructor and he did a fantastic job showing our class of 3 the necessary skills we needed to learn during the 2-day indoor training. Seth at the dive shop also did a fantastic job helping me pick the right gear I needed to begin my journey as a scuba diver especially when it came to wetsuit size selection. I was deciding between a size Medium suit versus a size Large suit and he stressed I get the Medium suit even though it was more snug and a little less comfortable than the Large suit. I’m sure glad I listened to his advice because being in the water long enough can make you cold and during the training I realized how much warmer I was in the more snug Medium wetsuit. So now that my indoor training is complete it’s now time for to go out and get my Open Water training completed. Wish me luck and once again thank you Tom and Seth of Adventure Scuba. - Nolan

I was deciding between a size Medium suit versus a size Large suit and he stressed I get the Medium suit even though it was more snug and a little less comfortable than the Large suit. I’m sure glad I listened to his advice because being in the water long enough can make you cold and during the training I realized how much warmer I was in the more snug Medium wetsuit. originalText.text: From buying the right gear to navigating dive tables and mask clearing, the team at Adventure Scuba knew what they were talking about and shared that knowledge easily. Their friendly and informal office is a perfect welcome to the dive community - a refreshing vibe after coming off the harried streets of the city. In terms of the pool segment, it was pure fun. Without a single stressful moment, I felt considerably more confident in my dive skills by the end of the class. Would highly recommend!
